nodes.bodyText: this factory does not need creating if condition below is met
reader is a shared resource - SQL code generator must not assign it to the factory, but close it instead in try() block.
this cursor should not need base factory
Reader must not be held by factory. This is a resource hungry instance, which are shared through the engine. Factory must hold on to the CairoEngine instance instead and table name.
it is better to pass column index
not sure why we need column filter?
nodes.diffHunk:

+    public DistinctSymbolRecordCursorFactory(
+            RecordCursorFactory base,
+            EntityColumnFilter columnFilter,

nodes.bodyText: when you have CairoEngine - this is the place to get reader
there is method Misc.free() that does something like this
we need one more test where symbol value is NULL
what is happening here? :) you already have column index
you shouldn't need to pass TableReader to record. Record needs SymbolMapReader

we can avoid calling for every value of the result set
reader.getSymbolMapReader(columnIndex)

reader null check should not be necessary when Record is setup correctly. If reader is every to become null this should be reported where cursor is requested (don't think null is possible at all in this case)

I would suggest making DistinctSymbolRecord non-static class. This way it can access symbol map reader on factory instance and only have its own record index.
This said, recordB is better be created lazily. It is only used when someone is ordering symbols returned by this cursor. Which is not very often.
spelling disticntSymbolMetadata
factory must close its cursor (which is closeable)
minor: toTop() and record.reset() implement the same logic, perhaps topTop() can call recordA.reset(). Or may be record.reset() could be renamed to record.toTop()
Can we pull this value up StaticSymbolTable interface level? The idea of static symbol table is that it is bounded, e.g. knows of its size and presumably that it knows that it has null?
sure
this write should be cached i feel like, e.g. read of class member is faster than write to memory mapped file
yes, working on that, just wanted to push the latest changes
I don't follow this condition. Why are we comparing int value of symbol to size of symbol map?

the reason is that the symboMapReader.size() still returns the number of symbols without counting the null value. on the other hand, record.hasNext() now returns true one final time if the symbolMapReader contains a null symbol
perfect, understood, thanks!
missed a spot
